abstract.p: Tokyo-based credit research organization Teikoku Databank says number of corporate bankruptcies in Japan rose 21.4 percent in July from year earlier, to 1,617 cases, with record debt of 4.26 trillion yen, or about $39 billion (S)

block.p: The number of corporate bankruptcies in Japan rose 21.4 percent in July from a year earlier, to 1,617 cases, with a record debt of 4.26 trillion yen, or about $39 billion, according to Teikoku Databank, a Tokyo-based credit research organization. The figures reflected the collapse of a department store chain, the Sogo Company and its affiliates, which contributed nearly $27 billion, or 69 percent of the total amount of debt, said Teikoku. Company failures could grow even faster, especially in light of the decision by the Bank of Japan last week to guide short-term interest rates higher for the first time in a decade.
